intro: Unonopsis, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araliaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, particularly in countries like Brazil and Colombia. The plant typically features large, palmately compound leaves and produces clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle the plant with care.
